results.title: Platelet adhesion in hyperlipidemic and hypertensive patients.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@Propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly reduced platelet @<m>DISEASE_Tissue_Adhesions</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000267 @@@adhesion@@@, but this effect was found to take a longer time than that required for significant @DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@blood pressure reduction@@@.

citations.NLM: Brook JG, Marmur A, Berkovitch Y, Aviram M. Platelet adhesion in hyperlipidemic and hypertensive patients. Haemostasis. 1985;15(6):371-6. PMID: 4076844
citations.BibTeX: @article{4076844, title={Platelet adhesion in hyperlipidemic and hypertensive patients.}, author={Brook JG and Marmur A and Berkovitch Y and Aviram M}, journal={Haemostasis}, volume={15}, number={6}, pages={371-6}}
